result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Case is Dismissed and read in to case 20CF1639.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angelica T Waters

records.addlTxt:
2:29 PM Defendant Angelica T Waters in court.  Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Angelica T Waters.  Prosecuting attorney Shawn N Woller in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for plea hearing.
Attorney Tapia filed a DPA with a plea questionnaire into 20CF1639 that Defendant is enrolled in Milwaukee Drug Treatment Court. 
If program successfully completed, cases would be dismissed. 
Case is Dismissed and read in to case 20CF1639.
Plea hearing on August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 2:43 PM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Angelica T Waters in court by zoom with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Court will set the case over to a different date for a plea hearing so the defendant can be present in person.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

to the Court filed by Atty. Ricardo Tapia requesting Court allow defendant to appear by Zoom for 8/1 Plea hearing.

**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 07/28/22--Approved.**

LF 7/28--advised parties by email.
Plea hearing on August 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

10:10 AM Defendant Angelica T Waters in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was set for plea hearing, but the DPA offer was contigent on Defendant's acceptance into Milwaukee's DTC.
Defendant has her hearing there on 7/12/22. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:30 AM Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court.   Defendant Angelica T Waters did not appear.   Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised attorney she would be late. 
Case is still on track for a deferred prosecution agreement contingent on Milwaukee case.
State requests a capias be imposed and stayed until 12:00 today. 
Court imposes, but stays a Branch 2 Only capias until 12:00. 
If Defendant does not appear by noon, Court will issue a Branch 2 Only capias and revoke and forfeit bond. 
  Plea hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:58 AM Defendant appeared in courtroom. Case was not recalled on the record. Defendant was handed the Notice of Hearing for the next hearing by the Clerk. Court will not issue a Capias or revoke and forfeit bail.
Plea hearing on May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:52 AM Defendant Angelica T Waters in court with attorney Ricardo Tapia.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for status.
Defendant is eligible for Drug Treatment Court in Milwaukee County starting 5/03/2022.
Defense is hoping for a Deferred Prosecution Agreement and to enter a plea after that date.
Defendant provides the court with updated contact information.
  Plea hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Angelica T Waters

Prior: 949 N 9th St., C/O Milwaukee County Jail, Milwaukee, WI 53233 United States

addressed to: Angelica T Waters for hearing on 04/22/22 
Return to Sender, Attempted--Not Known, Unable to Forward.
Detainer Lift sent to:  Milwaukee County Jail by fax
Fax received from MHOC
Detainer placed at: Milwaukee County Jail
Hearing on April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

10:03 AM Defendant Angelica T Waters in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Voge, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for initial appearance.
Court quashes warrant.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Criminal Complaint and waives further reading.  
State requests cash bail.  Statements by defense.  Court orders cash bail in the amount of $250.00.
Defense advises this will likely be a waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.
Defense requests further proceedings date.
  Hearing scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
